definition[1]: a hollow sound is low and clear like the sound made when you hit something empty
example[1]: There was a hollow thump as the cars collided.
definition[2]: words, events, or people that are hollow have no real worth or value
example[2]: They won, but it was a hollow victory.
example[3]: Even as he spoke, Ivan was well aware of the hollow ring to his words.
definition[3]: a place in something that is at a slightly lower level than its surface
example[4]: Make a slight hollow in the middle of each cake.
definition[4]: to make the surface of something curve inwards
example[5]: The steps were hollowed by centuries of use.
